title: Add MCP tool annotations (readOnlyHint, idempotentHint)
description:
Add MCP tool annotations from the Nov 2025 spec to all 4 dynamic tools. All Axiom tools are read-only documentation lookups, so declare readOnlyHint: true and destructiveHint: false. This enables auto-approval in Claude Code, ChatGPT, and other MCP clients.

Spec: https://modelcontextprotocol.io/specification/2025-11-25/server/tools

Annotations to add per tool:
- readOnlyHint: true (all 4 tools)
- destructiveHint: false (all 4 tools)  
- idempotentHint: true (all 4 tools — same input = same output)
- openWorldHint: false (catalog, search, read) / true (run_agent if it ever executes)

title: Validate all Axiom skills with 3-scenario pressure testing
description:
Run 3-scenario pressure validation on all 121 unvalidated Axiom skills. Create bd issues for any that don't pass as STRONG.

## Methodology

Each skill gets 3 pressure scenarios tailored to its type:
- **Discipline skills** (no suffix): Time Pressure, Constraint Mismatch, Edge Case — test anti-rationalization and decision tree coverage
- **Reference skills** (-ref): API completeness, cross-platform edge case, migration/upgrade path
- **Diagnostic skills** (-diag): Symptom-to-cause accuracy, intermittent issue handling, misdiagnosis prevention
- **Router skills** (ios-*): Correct routing for overlapping domains, ambiguous symptoms, multi-domain issues

## Validation Agent Prompt Template

```
You are a skill validation agent. Read the skill file at `/Users/Charles/Projects/Axiom/.claude-plugin/plugins/axiom/skills/SKILL_NAME/SKILL.md` and evaluate it against 3 pressure scenarios.

### Scenario 1: Time Pressure
**Setup**: [Realistic deadline scenario relevant to skill domain]
**Test**: [Does the skill prevent the shortcut/mistake?]
**Pass**: [Specific content that must exist]

### Scenario 2: Constraint Mismatch
**Setup**: [Conflicting requirements relevant to skill domain]
**Test**: [Does the skill address the constraint?]
**Pass**: [Specific guidance that must exist]

### Scenario 3: Edge Case
**Setup**: [Uncommon but real scenario in skill domain]
**Test**: [Does the skill cover this case?]
**Pass**: [Specific content that must exist]

Output: One paragraph per scenario with PASS/FAIL, then OVERALL rating (STRONG/ADEQUATE/WEAK/FAILED) on its own line.
```

## Rating Scale
- **STRONG**: 3/3 pass — no action needed
- **ADEQUATE**: 2/3 pass — create bd issue with the failed scenario, fix, revalidate
- **WEAK**: 1/3 pass — create bd issue, needs significant content addition
- **FAILED**: 0/3 pass — create bd issue, may need rewrite

## Workflow
1. Run validation in batches of 5 (sonnet model, parallel agents)
2. For ADEQUATE/WEAK: fix immediately if restorable from pre-reduction git, otherwise create issue
3. Revalidate fixes before closing issues
4. Prompt user between batches

## Already Validated (19 skills — all STRONG)
axiom-liquid-glass, axiom-sqlitedata-ref, axiom-swiftui-26-ref, axiom-extensions-widgets-ref, axiom-foundation-models-ref, axiom-foundation-models, axiom-swiftui-animation-ref, axiom-liquid-glass-ref, axiom-swiftui-nav-ref, axiom-swift-performance, axiom-swiftui-architecture, axiom-hig-ref, axiom-swiftdata, axiom-app-composition, axiom-network-framework-ref, axiom-app-intents-ref, axiom-swiftui-debugging, axiom-now-playing, axiom-networking

title: Unify error handling for missing resources across MCP tool handlers
description: Inconsistent error handling: handleRunAgent (handler.ts:280-282) throws Error('Agent not found') for missing agents, but handleReadSkill (handler.ts:238-240, 254-256) returns inline 'Skill not found.' text in a success response. MCP clients see error response for agents but success response for skills. Pick one strategy — the inline approach is better for multi-skill reads but should be documented.
close_reason: Closed

title: Add bounds validation for limit and batch size on MCP tools
description: axiom_search_skills passes args.limit directly to search with no bounds validation. Negative values cause .slice(0, -N) to drop elements unexpectedly. axiom_read_skill has no upper bound on the skills array — a caller could request all 68 skills in one call. Add clamping: limit to Math.max(1, Math.min(limit, 50)) and skills array max length of 10.
close_reason: Closed

title: Validate: core-location-diag (15.9KB)

title: Add listChanged notifications for dynamic tool updates
description:
The MCP spec supports notifying clients when tools change dynamically via listChanged notifications. This could enable context-specific tool registration — e.g. if the user is working on SwiftUI, register SwiftUI-specific tools and notify the client.

This is a forward-looking feature. Current implementation is static (4 tools always registered). Dynamic registration would allow:
- Context-aware tool surfacing
- Reduced initial tool set
- Client-driven tool discovery

Spec: https://modelcontextprotocol.io/specification/2025-11-25/server/tools (listChanged capability)

Requires research into which MCP clients actually support listChanged notifications.
close_reason: Added listChanged notification support. DevLoader.onChange() callback fires on file changes. index.ts wires it to server.sendToolListChanged(). tools capability declares listChanged: true in dev mode only.

title: Incremental Apple docs indexing instead of full rebuild
description:
When Apple docs load at runtime, the ProdLoader currently throws away the pre-serialized MiniSearch index from the bundle and rebuilds from scratch. This is wasteful — ~20 Apple docs trigger a full index rebuild of 100+ skills.

Instead, deserialize the bundle index first, then incrementally add Apple doc entries to it.

Current (prod-loader.ts):
1. Deserialize bundle search index
2. Load Apple docs
3. Rebuild entire index from scratch (discards deserialized index)

Proposed:
1. Deserialize bundle search index  
2. Load Apple docs
3. Add Apple doc entries incrementally to existing index
4. Update _sectionTerms map for new docs

MiniSearch supports .add() on existing instances. Need to also handle _sectionTerms separately since that's our custom structure.

Files: mcp-server/src/loader/prod-loader.ts, mcp-server/src/search/index.ts
close_reason: Added addSkills() function for incremental MiniSearch index updates. ProdLoader now adds Apple docs incrementally instead of rebuilding the entire index.

Add a VALID_SKILL_TYPES set and validate before casting. Fall through to name-based inference if the value is not in the set.

title: Rename axiom_run_agent to axiom_get_agent
description:
axiom_run_agent doesn't execute agents — it returns their prompts and metadata for the client to execute. The name is misleading per MCP conventions where 'run' implies execution.

Rename to axiom_get_agent to accurately reflect behavior. This is a breaking change for any existing MCP clients using the tool name.

Consider:
- Whether any clients are using the current name (check npm download stats)
- Whether to support both names during a transition period
- Update README and documentation

title: Add rich serverInstructions for MCP Tool Search discovery
description:
Claude Code 2.1.7+ has built-in MCP Tool Search that activates when tool descriptions exceed 10% of context. The serverInstructions field becomes the primary discovery mechanism — it must clearly describe capabilities and include keywords users would use in prompts.

Add a comprehensive serverInstructions string to the MCP server capabilities that includes:
- What Axiom is (iOS development knowledge base)
- Key domains covered (SwiftUI, Swift concurrency, Core Data, performance, accessibility, etc.)
- Common symptoms/questions it handles (build failures, memory leaks, data races, etc.)
- How to use the 4 tools (discovery workflow: catalog → search → read)

Source: https://claudefa.st/blog/tools/mcp-extensions/mcp-tool-search
Results: 95% reduction in initial context (92k→5k tokens), accuracy 49%→74%

File: mcp-server/src/index.ts (Server capabilities)
close_reason: Implemented tool annotations and server instructions

title: Convert ASCII decision trees to DOT flowcharts in routers
description: Replace ASCII tree diagrams in all 10 router skills (.claude-plugin/plugins/axiom/skills/routers/) with inline DOT/Graphviz flowcharts. Superpowers found Claude follows DOT directed graphs more reliably than prose or ASCII art for decision logic. DOT format: digraph { node [shape=diamond] for decisions, [shape=box] for actions, edges with labels for conditions. Each router's decision tree should become a DOT digraph.
close_reason: Replaced ASCII decision trees with ordered conditional lists in all 13 routers. Net -43 lines.

title: Expand rationalization prevention tables in router skills
description:
Expand brief Anti-Rationalization sections in all 10 router skills into full excuse/reality tables. Two-layer problem:

Layer 1 (using-axiom → router): Already has 11-row table preventing router skipping. Works but may need reinforcement.

Layer 2 (router → specialized skill): Currently minimal (ios-build has 2 items) or missing entirely (ios-ui has none). This is the primary gap. Claude reads the router then rationalizes it can handle the issue without loading the deeper skill.

Both failure modes observed: Claude skips routers despite using-axiom AND skips specialized skills after reading router.

Implementation: Add domain-specific | Thought | Reality | tables to each router. Each table should cover 4-6 rationalizations specific to that domain (e.g., ios-build: 'Just a linker error, I know the fix'; ios-ui: 'Simple SwiftUI layout, no need for the layout skill'). Backed by Meincke et al. (2025) research showing 33% to 72% compliance improvement with explicit anti-rationalization tables.
close_reason: Expanded Anti-Rationalization in all 13 routers to full Thought/Reality tables with 3-5 domain-specific entries each

title: Add Transferable/CoreTransferable reference skill
description: Create axiom-transferable-ref skill covering the CoreTransferable framework and cross-app content sharing patterns. Key topics: TransferRepresentation types (ProxyRepresentation, CodableRepresentation, FileRepresentation, DataRepresentation), TransferRepresentationVisibility, ShareLink, UTType declarations, NSItemProvider bridging, and the AppEntity + Transferable intersection pattern. Source material: https://www.createwithswift.com/sharing-content-among-apps-using-appentity-and-transferable-protocol/ and Apple CoreTransferable documentation.
notes:
## Reading List

Resources for (1) building the Transferable/CoreTransferable reference skill and (2) leveling-up related skills (axiom-app-intents-ref, axiom-photo-library-ref, axiom-swiftui-26-ref).

### WWDC Sessions

- WWDC25-244: Get to know App Intents — ground-up overview of intents, entities, queries
- WWDC25-275: Explore new advances in App Intents — newer framework capabilities
- WWDC25-260: Develop for Shortcuts and Spotlight with App Intents — entities/actions in system surfaces
- WWDC24-10134: What's new in App Intents — explicitly covers making entities Transferable
- WWDC24: Bring your app's core features to users with App Intents — practical entity/query guidance
- WWDC23-10102: Spotlight your app with App Shortcuts — design + surfacing actions
- WWDC23-10103: Explore enhancements to App Intents — advanced patterns, dynamic options
- WWDC22-10170: Implement App Shortcuts with App Intents — foundational mechanics
- WWDC22-10062: Meet Transferable — canonical intro to Transferable protocol and representations
- WWDC22-10052: What's new in SwiftUI — ShareLink-era sharing APIs built on Transferable

### Apple Documentation (sosumi.ai paths)

#### App Intents / Entities
- /appintents — framework overview
- /appintents/appentity — @Property, identity, display reps
- /appintents/app-entities — concept overview
- /appintents/entity-queries — system entity resolution
- /appintents/appintent — defining actions
- /appintents/app-shortcuts, /appintents/appshortcutsprovider — preconfigured shortcuts
- /appintents/urlrepresentableentity — deep-link representations
- /appintents/integrating-custom-types-into-your-intents — identity/unique ID patterns
- /appintents/acceleratingappinteractionswithappintents — end-to-end patterns

#### Core Transferable / Sharing
- /coretransferable — framework overview
- /coretransferable/transferable — protocol
- /coretransferable/choosing-a-transfer-representation-for-a-model-type — decision guide
- /coretransferable/transferrepresentation, /coretransferable/transferrepresentationbuilder — builder concepts
- /coretransferable/proxyrepresentation — export as system-recognized types
- /coretransferable/datarepresentation — binary payload path
- /coretransferable/transferrepresentationvisibility — visibility controls

#### SwiftUI Surface
- /swiftui/sharelink — share sheet via Transferable

### Articles and Worked Examples
- Create with Swift: Sharing content among apps using AppEntity and Transferable — https://www.createwithswift.com/sharing-content-among-apps-using-appentity-and-transferable-protocol/
- Lickability: App Intents querying patterns — https://lickability.com/blog/app-intents/
- Swift with Majid: ShareLink + Transferable — https://swiftwithmajid.com/2023/03/28/sharing-content-in-swiftui/
- SerialCoder: ProxyRepresentation patterns — https://serialcoder.dev/text-tutorials/swiftui/transferable-protocol-in-swiftui-transferring-alternative-content-with-proxyrepresentation/
- nonstrict.eu: FileRepresentation pitfall case study — https://nonstrict.eu/blog/2023/transferable-drag-drop-fails-with-only-FileRepresentation
- Apple Forums: Share multiple Transferables with ShareLink — https://developer.apple.com/forums/thread/745611

### Suggested Research Order
1. WWDC25-244 (App Intents ground-up) + docs: /appintents, /appintents/appentity, /appintents/entity-queries
2. WWDC22-10062 (Meet Transferable) + docs: /coretransferable/transferable, choosing representations, /coretransferable/proxyrepresentation, visibility
3. Re-read Create with Swift tutorial, map each step to Apple docs
4. WWDC24-10134 (Transferable + entities in system surfaces) + Lickability query article

title: Document token efficiency techniques for skills
description: Add section to .claude/rules/skill-descriptions.md covering token efficiency techniques learned from Superpowers: (1) Cross-references instead of duplication — 'See swift-concurrency for async patterns' instead of repeating content; (2) Compressed examples — show pattern once, reference for variants; (3) --help references — point to CLI tool help instead of documenting flags; (4) Conditional depth — shallow by default, deep on request; (5) Compact code patterns — single canonical example per concept. Goal: reduce average skill token count by 20-30% without losing effectiveness.
close_reason: Added Description Trap + token efficiency to skill-descriptions.md, created persuasion-principles.md, enhanced TDD workflow in skill-development.md

title: Add persuasion principles reference for skill authors
description: Create .claude/rules/persuasion-principles.md adapting Cialdini's 7 principles for Axiom skill design context. Covers: (1) Authority — cite WWDC sessions, Apple engineers; (2) Social proof — 'most iOS apps that ship successfully...'; (3) Consistency — reference user's own stated goals; (4) Scarcity — time costs of skipping ('costs 30+ minutes'); (5) Reciprocity — skill provides value before asking compliance; (6) Liking — conversational, non-judgmental tone; (7) Unity — 'we as iOS developers'. Provide examples specific to Axiom skill writing.
close_reason: Added Description Trap + token efficiency to skill-descriptions.md, created persuasion-principles.md, enhanced TDD workflow in skill-development.md

title: Add file watcher for auto-reload in dev mode
description:
DevLoader requires manual server restart when SKILL.md files change during development. Add a file watcher to auto-reload skills, commands, and agents when their source files change.

Options:
- Node built-in fs.watch() (no dependency, but platform quirks)
- chokidar (popular, reliable, but adds dependency)

Watch paths:
- {pluginPath}/skills/*/SKILL.md
- {pluginPath}/commands/*.md
- {pluginPath}/agents/*.md

On change:
- Invalidate skill/command/agent caches
- Rebuild search index
- Rebuild catalog
- Log what changed

File: mcp-server/src/loader/dev-loader.ts
close_reason: Added file watcher to DevLoader using fs.watch (recursive, Node 22). Watches skills/commands/agents directories, debounces changes (200ms), invalidates relevant caches. startWatching() called automatically in dev mode from index.ts. classifyChange() unit tested.

title: Add sync getter methods to Loader interface or remove from implementations
description:
## Problem

Both \`DevLoader\` and \`ProdLoader\` implement synchronous getter methods that are NOT on the \`Loader\` interface:

- \`getSkills(): Map<string, Skill>\`
- \`getCommands(): Map<string, Command>\`
- \`getAgents(): Map<string, Agent>\`

These return the internal cache directly. Since they're not on the interface, consumers typed as \`Loader\` cannot access them. This creates an asymmetry:

- If the methods are needed by external consumers → add to \`Loader\` interface
- If they're only used internally or are dead code → remove from both implementations

## Investigation Needed

Search for usages of \`getSkills()\`, \`getCommands()\`, \`getAgents()\` (the sync versions, not \`loadSkills()\` etc.) to determine if they're called through the \`Loader\` type or directly on concrete instances.

## Files

- \`mcp-server/src/loader/types.ts\` — potentially add methods to interface
- \`mcp-server/src/loader/dev-loader.ts\` — potentially remove methods
- \`mcp-server/src/loader/prod-loader.ts\` — potentially remove methods

## Origin

Code review finding #13 from MCP Server Epic Cleanup.
close_reason: Removed dead sync getter methods (getSkills, getCommands, getAgents) from both DevLoader and ProdLoader. Never called anywhere.

title: Integrate Apple's Xcode-bundled for-LLM documentation into Axiom
description:
Apple ships 52 for-LLM markdown files inside Xcode (20 AdditionalDocumentation guides + 32 Swift diagnostics docs). Axiom should ingest these as a content source in both the MCP server and Claude Code plugin.

AdditionalDocumentation (208KB): Liquid Glass (SwiftUI/UIKit/AppKit/WidgetKit), Swift 6.2 concurrency, Foundation Models, SwiftData class inheritance, StoreKit updates, App Intents updates, WebKit integration, styled text editing, AttributedString, 3D charts, visual intelligence, assistive access, MapKit/GeoToolbox, AlarmKit, visionOS widgets.

Swift diagnostics (32 files): actor-isolated-call, sending-risks-data-race, isolated-conformances, mutable-global-variable, sendable-closure-captures, nonisolated-nonsending-by-default, and 26 more compiler error explanations with code fixes.

Paths:
- /Applications/Xcode.app/Contents/PlugIns/IDEIntelligenceChat.framework/Versions/A/Resources/AdditionalDocumentation/*.md
- /Applications/Xcode.app/Contents/Developer/Toolchains/XcodeDefault.xctoolchain/usr/share/doc/swift/diagnostics/*.md

Implementation: Runtime reading from Xcode (no bundling). New axiom-apple-docs router skill for plugin. Source field on Skill interface. Apple doc category mapping. Graceful degradation when Xcode absent. See plan: virtual-prancing-rocket.md
close_reason: Implemented in v2.19.4 (commits b527573, 256c4fe). xcode-docs.ts reads 20 Apple guides + 32 Swift diagnostics at runtime. axiom-apple-docs router skill added. MCP server integration with source filtering complete.

title: Extract shared makeSkill/makeAgent test helpers to reduce test duplication
description:
## Problem

The \`makeSkill()\` factory helper is duplicated identically in two test files:

- \`mcp-server/src/search/index.test.ts\` lines 5-15
- \`mcp-server/src/catalog/index.test.ts\` lines 5-15

Both also define similar \`makeAgent()\` helpers. As more test files are added, this pattern will spread.

## Proposed Fix

Extract to a shared test utilities file:

- NEW: \`mcp-server/src/test-helpers.ts\` (or \`src/__test__/factories.ts\`)
- Export \`makeSkill(overrides)\` and \`makeAgent(overrides)\`
- Update \`search/index.test.ts\` and \`catalog/index.test.ts\` to import from shared file

## Files

- NEW: \`mcp-server/src/test-helpers.ts\`
- \`mcp-server/src/search/index.test.ts\` — import makeSkill
- \`mcp-server/src/catalog/index.test.ts\` — import makeSkill, makeAgent

## Origin

Code review finding #10 from MCP Server Epic Cleanup.
close_reason: Extracted makeSkill() and makeAgent() to shared test-helpers.ts. Updated search/index.test.ts and catalog/index.test.ts to import from shared file.

title: Unify duplicated BundleV2 interface between prod-loader and bundle.ts
description:
## Problem

The BundleV2 interface is defined in two places with slightly different shapes:

- `mcp-server/src/loader/prod-loader.ts` lines 10-18: `catalog?: CatalogResult`, `searchIndex?: SerializedSearchIndex` (optional fields — bundle may lack newer fields)
- `mcp-server/src/scripts/bundle.ts` lines 20-28: `catalog: CatalogResult | null`, `searchIndex: SerializedSearchIndex | null` (nullable — generator always includes the fields but initializes to null)

Both are valid for their contexts but risk drifting as fields are added.

## Proposed Fix

Extract a shared `BundleV2` interface into a new file (e.g., `mcp-server/src/bundle-types.ts` or add to `loader/types.ts`). Use optional fields (`?`) as the canonical shape since that's what the consumer (prod-loader) needs to handle. The generator (bundle.ts) can use a stricter local type or just assign non-null values.

## Files

- `mcp-server/src/loader/prod-loader.ts` — import shared type
- `mcp-server/src/scripts/bundle.ts` — import shared type
- NEW: shared type location (TBD)

## Origin

Code review finding #2 from MCP Server Epic Cleanup.
close_reason: Closed

title: Add bundle size tracking and regression testing
description:
Bundle size is not tracked or tested. There's no way to detect size regressions when skills are added or modified.

Add to bundle generation script (scripts/bundle.ts):
1. Log total bundle size and breakdown (skills vs commands vs agents vs search index)
2. Write size snapshot to a trackable file (e.g. dist/bundle-stats.json)
3. Optionally fail if bundle exceeds a threshold

Format for bundle-stats.json:
{
  "totalBytes": 1200000,
  "skills": { "count": 128, "bytes": 900000 },
  "commands": { "count": 10, "bytes": 50000 },
  "agents": { "count": 30, "bytes": 150000 },
  "searchIndex": { "bytes": 100000 },
  "generatedAt": "2026-02-04T..."
}

File: mcp-server/src/scripts/bundle.ts
close_reason: Added computeBundleStats() with size breakdown (skills/commands/agents/searchIndex). Bundle script now writes bundle-stats.json and logs size breakdown. Guarded main() to not execute on import. Tested.

title: Document 'The Description Trap' in skill rules
description: Add formal rule to .claude/rules/skill-descriptions.md that descriptions must ONLY contain trigger conditions, never workflow summaries. Include Superpowers' research finding as evidence: descriptions that summarize what a skill does (instead of when to use it) cause Claude to believe it already knows the content and skip invocation. This is 'The Description Trap' — the more helpful the description sounds, the less likely Claude is to actually load the skill.
close_reason: Added Description Trap + token efficiency to skill-descriptions.md, created persuasion-principles.md, enhanced TDD workflow in skill-development.md

title: Add camelCase splitting to search tokenizer for iOS API names
description: search/index.ts:59 tokenizes by splitting on non-alphanumeric characters only. PascalCase API names like NavigationStack become a single token 'navigationstack' that won't match a query for 'navigation'. Add .replace(/([a-z])([A-Z])/g, '$1 $2') before lowercasing to split camelCase boundaries. Significant search quality improvement for iOS skill base where API names are everywhere.
close_reason: Closed

title: Validate: background-processing-diag (12.9KB)

title: Enable fuzzy search and prefix matching in MiniSearch
description:
MiniSearch supports fuzzy matching (edit distance) and prefix matching out of the box, but neither is currently enabled. Enabling these handles typos gracefully — e.g. 'NavgationStack' still matches 'NavigationStack'.

Changes to mcp-server/src/search/index.ts:
- Add fuzzy: 0.2 to searchOptions (20% edit distance tolerance)
- Add prefix: true for prefix matching
- Consider combineWith: 'AND' for multi-word queries

Test: Verify typo queries still return relevant results, verify precision isn't degraded for exact queries.
close_reason: Closed

title: Add missing handler test coverage for getCatalog and searchSkills success paths
description:
## Problem

The handler test file (`mcp-server/src/tools/handler.test.ts`) has gaps in coverage:

- `handleGetCatalog`: No tests at all (including the `includeDescriptions` flag behavior)
- `handleSearchSkills`: Only tests limit clamping, missing success path with actual results and empty string query
- `handleReadSkill`: Missing `listSections` mode and filtered sections path
- `handleSearchSkills`: Missing test for invalid `query` type (number instead of string)

The existing 7 tests cover error paths and bounds validation well, but the happy paths for catalog and search are untested.

## Proposed Fix

Add tests for:

1. `handleGetCatalog` — returns formatted catalog, respects `includeDescriptions` flag, respects `category` filter
2. `handleSearchSkills` — returns formatted results on success, handles empty string query
3. `handleReadSkill` — `listSections: true` returns section TOC, section filtering returns filtered content

Estimated: ~8-10 new test cases.

## Files

- `mcp-server/src/tools/handler.test.ts` — add test cases

## Origin

Code review finding #9 from MCP Server Epic Cleanup.
close_reason: Added 9 tests covering getCatalog (formatted output, includeDescriptions, category filter), searchSkills (formatted results, empty results, missing query), and readSkill (listSections TOC, section filtering, full content). 11→20 handler tests.

title: Add unit tests for MCP server pure functions
description: No test files exist for any of the new MCP server code. Priority test targets for the pure functions: (1) parseSections — edge cases: empty content, no h2 headings, only preamble, consecutive headings, h1-only files. (2) tokenize — empty string, single character, all stopwords, technical terms, camelCase after that fix lands. (3) buildIndex + search — basic BM25 correctness, field weighting, filter behavior, empty index. (4) buildCatalog — router reference extraction, name-based inference fallback, category filtering. (5) filterSections (after extraction) — section matching, no match returns empty, case-insensitive matching.
